question:
With regards to the Gondwana Rainforests in Australia being affected by the fires, consider the following statements:
  1. It is a world heritage site.
  2. It is located along the western coast of Australia.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Gondwana Rainforest was designated as a World Heritage Site in 1986. It is one of the most expansive subtropical rainforest in the world. It is noted for its biological diversity- especially of land snails and insects. The biodiversity is being threatened by the fires raging in the region. Statement 2 is incorrect: The Gondwana Rainforests is composed of 50 reserves stretching along the eastern coast of Australia- from Newcastle to Brisbane. It covers an area of 366,500 hectares. The forests have many species with origin in the Gondwana period. Australia is one of the 17 megadiverse countries in the world.
